property.name: ozone.container.cache.size
property.description: The open container is cached on the data node side. We maintain an LRU cache for caching the recently used containers. This setting controls the size of that cache.

property.name: dfs.container.ipc
property.description: The ipc port number of container.

property.name: dfs.container.ipc.random.port
property.description: Allocates a random free port for ozone container. This is used only while running unit tests.

property.name: dfs.container.chunk.write.sync
property.description: Determines whether the chunk writes in the container happen as sync I/0 or buffered I/O operation.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.statemachinedata.sync.timeout
property.description: Timeout for StateMachine data writes by Ratis.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.statemachinedata.sync.retries
property.description: Number of times the WriteStateMachineData op will be tried before failing, if this value is -1, then this retries indefinitely.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.log.queue.num-elements
property.description: Limit for the number of operations in Ratis Log Worker.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.log.queue.byte-limit
property.description: Byte limit for Ratis Log Worker queue.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.log.appender.queue.num-elements
property.description: Limit for number of append entries in ratis leader's log appender queue.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.log.appender.queue.byte-limit
property.description: Byte limit for ratis leader's log appender queue.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.datanode.storage.dir
property.description: This directory is used for storing Ratis metadata like logs. If this is not set then default metadata dirs is used. A warning will be logged if this not set. Ideally, this should be mapped to a fast disk like an SSD.

property.name: hdds.datanode.dir
property.description: Determines where on the local filesystem HDDS data will be stored. Defaults to dfs.datanode.data.dir if not specified. The directories should be tagged with corresponding storage types ([SSD]/[DISK]/[ARCHIVE]/[RAM_DISK]) for storage policies. The default storage type will be DISK if the directory does not have a storage type tagged explicitly.

property.name: hdds.datanode.volume.choosing.policy
property.description: The class name of the policy for choosing volumes in the list of directories. Defaults to org.apache.hadoop.ozone.container.common.volume.RoundRobinVolumeChoosingPolicy. This volume choosing policy selects volumes in a round-robin order.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.enabled
property.description: Ozone supports different kinds of replication pipelines. Ratis is one of the replication pipeline supported by ozone.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.ipc
property.description: The ipc port number of container.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.ipc.random.port
property.description: Allocates a random free port for ozone ratis port for the container. This is used only while running unit tests.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.rpc.type
property.description: Ratis supports different kinds of transports like netty, GRPC, Hadoop RPC etc. This picks one of those for this cluster.

property.name: dfs.ratis.snapshot.threshold
property.description: Number of transactions after which a ratis snapshot should be taken.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.num.write.chunk.threads
property.description: Maximum number of threads in the thread pool that Ratis will use for writing chunks (60 by default).

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.replication.level
property.description: Replication level to be used by datanode for submitting a container command to ratis. Available replication levels are ALL and MAJORTIY, MAJORITY is used as the default replication level.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.num.container.op.executors
property.description: Number of executors that will be used by Ratis to execute container ops.(10 by default).

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.segment.size
property.description: The size of the raft segment used by Apache Ratis on datanodes. (16 KB by default)

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.segment.preallocated.size
property.description: The size of the buffer which is preallocated for raft segment used by Apache Ratis on datanodes.(16 KB by default)

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.statemachine.cache.expiry.interval
property.description: The interval till which the stateMachine data in ratis will be cached inside the ContainerStateMachine.

property.name: dfs.ratis.client.request.timeout.duration
property.description: The timeout duration for ratis client request.It should be set greater than leader election timeout in Ratis.

property.name: dfs.ratis.client.request.max.retries
property.description: Number of retries for ratis client request.

property.name: dfs.ratis.client.request.retry.interval
property.description: Interval between successive retries for a ratis client request.

property.name: dfs.ratis.server.retry-cache.timeout.duration
property.description: Retry Cache entry timeout for ratis server.

property.name: dfs.ratis.server.request.timeout.duration
property.description: The timeout duration for ratis server request.

property.name: dfs.ratis.leader.election.minimum.timeout.duration
property.description: The minimum timeout duration for ratis leader election. Default is 1s.

property.name: dfs.ratis.server.failure.duration
property.description: The timeout duration for ratis server failure detection, once the threshold has reached, the ratis state machine will be informed about the failure in the ratis ring

property.name: hdds.node.report.interval
property.description: Time interval of the datanode to send node report. Each datanode periodically send node report to SCM. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: hdds.container.report.interval
property.description: Time interval of the datanode to send container report. Each datanode periodically send container report to SCM. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: hdds.command.status.report.interval
property.description: Time interval of the datanode to send status of command execution. Each datanode periodically the execution status of commands received from SCM to SCM. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: hdds.pipeline.report.interval
property.description: Time interval of the datanode to send pipeline report. Each datanode periodically send pipeline report to SCM. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: hdds.prometheus.endpoint.enabled
property.description: Enable prometheus compatible metric page on the HTTP servers.

property.name: hdds.profiler.endpoint.enabled
property.description: Enable /prof java profiler servlet page on HTTP server.

property.name: ozone.administrators
property.description: Ozone administrator users delimited by the comma. If not set, only the user who launches an ozone service will be the admin user. This property must be set if ozone services are started by different users. Otherwise, the RPC layer will reject calls from other servers which are started by users not in the list.

property.name: ozone.block.deleting.container.limit.per.interval
property.description: A maximum number of containers to be scanned by block deleting service per time interval. The block deleting service spawns a thread to handle block deletions in a container. This property is used to throttle the number of threads spawned for block deletions.

property.name: ozone.block.deleting.limit.per.task
property.description: A maximum number of blocks to be deleted by block deleting service per time interval. This property is used to throttle the actual number of block deletions on a data node per container.

property.name: ozone.block.deleting.service.interval
property.description: Time interval of the block deleting service. The block deleting service runs on each datanode periodically and deletes blocks queued for deletion. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: ozone.block.deleting.service.timeout
property.description: A timeout value of block deletion service. If this is set greater than 0, the service will stop waiting for the block deleting completion after this time. If timeout happens to a large proportion of block deletion, this needs to be increased with ozone.block.deleting.limit.per.task. This setting supports multiple time unit suffixes as described in dfs.heartbeat.interval. If no suffix is specified, then milliseconds is assumed.

property.name: ozone.UnsafeByteOperations.enabled
property.description: It specifies whether to use unsafe or safe buffer to byteString copy.

property.name: ozone.client.connection.timeout
property.description: Connection timeout for Ozone client in milliseconds.

property.name: ozone.client.stream.buffer.flush.size
property.description: Size which determines at what buffer position , a partial flush will be initiated during write. It should be ideally a multiple of chunkSize.

property.name: ozone.client.stream.buffer.max.size
property.description: Size which determines at what buffer position, write call be blocked till acknowledgement of the first partial flush happens by all servers.

property.name: ozone.client.watch.request.timeout
property.description: Timeout for the watch API in Ratis client to acknowledge a particular request getting replayed to all servers.

property.name: ozone.client.max.retries
property.description: Maximum number of retries by Ozone Client on encountering exception while writing a key.

property.name: ozone.client.protocol
property.description: Protocol class to be used by the client to connect to ozone cluster. The build-in implementation includes: org.apache.hadoop.ozone.client.rpc.RpcClient for RPC org.apache.hadoop.ozone.client.rest.RestClient for REST The default is the RpClient. Please do not change this unless you have a very good understanding of what you are doing.

property.name: ozone.client.socket.timeout
property.description: Socket timeout for Ozone client. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: ozone.enabled
property.description:
Status of the Ozone Object Storage service is enabled. Set to true to enable Ozone. Set to false to disable Ozone. Unless this value is set to true, Ozone services will not be started in the cluster.
Please note: By default ozone is disabled on a hadoop cluster.

property.name: ozone.key.deleting.limit.per.task
property.description: A maximum number of keys to be scanned by key deleting service per time interval in OM. Those keys are sent to delete metadata and generate transactions in SCM for next async deletion between SCM and DataNode.

property.name: ozone.om.service.ids
property.description:
Comma-separated list of OM service Ids.
If not set, the default value of "om-service-value" is assigned as the OM service ID.

property.name: ozone.om.nodes.EXAMPLEOMSERVICEID
property.description:
Comma-separated list of OM node Ids for a given OM service ID (eg. EXAMPLEOMSERVICEID). The OM service ID should be the value (one of the values if there are multiple) set for the parameter ozone.om.service.ids.
Unique identifiers for each OM Node, delimited by commas. This will be used by OzoneManagers in HA setup to determine all the OzoneManagers belonging to the same OMservice in the cluster. For example, if you used “omService1” as the OM service ID previously, and you wanted to use “om1”, “om2” and "om3" as the individual IDs of the OzoneManagers, you would configure a property ozone.om.nodes.omService1, and its value "om1,om2,om3".

property.name: ozone.om.node.id
property.description:
The ID of this OM node. If the OM node ID is not configured it is determined automatically by matching the local node's address with the configured address.
If node ID is not deterministic from the configuration, then it is set to the OmId from the OM version file.

property.name: ozone.om.address
property.description: The address of the Ozone OM service. This allows clients to discover the address of the OM.

property.name: ozone.om.group.rights
property.description: Default group permissions in Ozone OM.

property.name: ozone.om.handler.count.key
property.description: The number of RPC handler threads for OM service endpoints.

property.name: ozone.om.http-address
property.description:
The address and the base port where the OM web UI will listen on.
If the port is 0, then the server will start on a free port. However, it is best to specify a well-known port, so it is easy to connect and see the OM management UI.

property.name: ozone.om.http-bind-host
property.description: The actual address the OM web server will bind to. If this optional the address is set, it overrides only the hostname portion of ozone.om.http-address.

property.name: ozone.om.http.enabled
property.description: Property to enable or disable OM web user interface.

property.name: ozone.om.https-address
property.description: The address and the base port where the OM web UI will listen on using HTTPS. If the port is 0 then the server will start on a free port.

property.name: ozone.om.https-bind-host
property.description: The actual address the OM web server will bind to using HTTPS. If this optional address is set, it overrides only the hostname portion of ozone.om.http-address.

property.name: ozone.om.keytab.file
property.description: The keytab file for Kerberos authentication in OM.

property.name: ozone.om.db.cache.size.mb
property.description:
The size of OM DB cache in MB that used for caching files. This value is set to an abnormally low value in the default configuration. That is to make unit testing easy. Generally, this value should be set to something like 16GB or more, if you intend to use Ozone at scale.
A large value for this key allows a proportionally larger amount of OM metadata to be cached in memory. This makes OM operations faster.

property.name: ozone.om.user.max.volume
property.description: The maximum number of volumes a user can have on a cluster.Increasing or decreasing this number has no real impact on ozone cluster. This is defined only for operational purposes. Only an administrator can create a volume, once a volume is created there are no restrictions on the number of buckets or keys inside each bucket a user can create.

property.name: ozone.om.user.rights
property.description: Default user permissions used in OM.

property.name: ozone.om.db.dirs
property.description:
Directory where the OzoneManager stores its metadata. This should be specified as a single directory. If the directory does not exist then the OM will attempt to create it.
If undefined, then the OM will log a warning and fallback to ozone.metadata.dirs.

property.name: ozone.metadata.dirs
property.description:
This setting is the fallback location for SCM, OM and DataNodes to store their metadata. This setting may be used in test/PoC clusters to simplify configuration.
For production clusters or any time you care about performance, it is recommended that ozone.om.db.dirs, ozone.scm.db.dirs and dfs.container.ratis.datanode.storage.dir be configured separately.

property.name: ozone.metastore.impl
property.description: Ozone metadata store implementation. Ozone metadata are well distributed to multiple services such as ozoneManager, scm. They are stored in some local key-value databases. This property determines which database library to use. Supported value is either LevelDB or RocksDB.

property.name: ozone.metastore.rocksdb.statistics
property.description: The statistics level of the rocksdb store. If you use any value from org.rocksdb.StatsLevel (eg. ALL or EXCEPT_DETAILED_TIMERS), the rocksdb statistics will be exposed over JMX bean with the choosed setting. Set it to OFF to not initialize rocksdb statistics at all. Please note that collection of statistics could have 5-10% performance penalty. Check the rocksdb documentation for more details.

property.name: ozone.scm.db.dirs
property.description:
Directory where the StorageContainerManager stores its metadata. This should be specified as a single directory. If the directory does not exist then the SCM will attempt to create it.
If undefined, then the SCM will log a warning and fallback to ozone.metadata.dirs.

property.name: ozone.scm.block.client.address
property.description: The address of the Ozone SCM block client service. If not defined value of ozone.scm.client.address is used.

property.name: ozone.scm.block.client.bind.host
property.description: The hostname or IP address used by the SCM block client endpoint to bind.

property.name: ozone.scm.block.client.port
property.description: The port number of the Ozone SCM block client service.

property.name: ozone.scm.block.deletion.max.retry
property.description: SCM wraps up many blocks in a deletion transaction and sends that to data node for physical deletion periodically. This property determines how many times SCM is going to retry sending a deletion operation to the data node.

property.name: ozone.scm.block.size
property.description: The default size of a scm block. This is maps to the default Ozone block size.

property.name: ozone.scm.chunk.size
property.description:
The chunk size for reading/writing chunk operations in bytes.
The chunk size defaults to 8MB. If the value configured is more than the maximum size (16MB), it will be reset to the maximum size. This maps to the network packet sizes and file write operations in the client to datanode protocol.

property.name: ozone.scm.client.address
property.description:
The address of the Ozone SCM client service. This is a required setting.
It is a string in the host:port format. The port number is optional and defaults to 9860.

property.name: ozone.scm.client.bind.host
property.description:
The hostname or IP address used by the SCM client endpoint to bind. This setting is used by the SCM only and never used by clients.
The setting can be useful in multi-homed setups to restrict the availability of the SCM client service to a specific interface.
The default is appropriate for most clusters.

property.name: ozone.scm.client.port
property.description: The port number of the Ozone SCM client service.

property.name: ozone.scm.keyvalue.container.deletion-choosing.policy
property.description: The policy used for choosing desired keyvalue containers for block deletion. Datanode selects some containers to process block deletion in a certain interval defined by ozone.block.deleting.service.interval. The number of containers to process in each interval is defined by ozone.block.deleting.container.limit.per.interval. This property is used to configure the policy applied while selecting containers. There are two policies supporting now: RandomContainerDeletionChoosingPolicy and TopNOrderedContainerDeletionChoosingPolicy. org.apache.hadoop.ozone.container.common.impl.RandomContainerDeletionChoosingPolicy implements a simply random policy that to return a random list of containers. org.apache.hadoop.ozone.container.common.impl.TopNOrderedContainerDeletionChoosingPolicy implements a policy that choosing top count number of containers in a pending-deletion-blocks's num based descending order.

property.name: ozone.scm.container.placement.impl
property.description: Placement policy class for containers. Defaults to SCMContainerPlacementRandom.class

property.name: ozone.scm.pipeline.owner.container.count
property.description: Number of containers per owner in a pipeline.

property.name: ozone.scm.container.size
property.description: Default container size used by Ozone. There are two considerations while picking this number. The speed at which a container can be replicated, determined by the network speed and the metadata that each container generates. So selecting a large number creates less SCM metadata, but recovery time will be more. 5GB is a number that maps to quick replication times in gigabit networks, but still balances the amount of metadata.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.address
property.description:
The address of the Ozone SCM service used for internal communication between the DataNodes and the SCM.
It is a string in the host:port format. The port number is optional and defaults to 9861.
This setting is optional. If unspecified then the hostname portion is picked from the ozone.scm.client.address setting and the default service port of 9861 is chosen.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.bind.host
property.description: The hostname or IP address used by the SCM service endpoint to bind.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.id
property.description: The path that datanodes will use to store the datanode ID. If this value is not set, then datanode ID is created under the metadata directory.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.port
property.description: The port number of the Ozone SCM service.

property.name: ozone.scm.db.cache.size.mb
property.description: SCM keeps track of the Containers in the cluster. This DB holds the container metadata. This value is set to a small value to make the unit testing runs smooth. In production, we recommend a value of 16GB or higher. This allows SCM to avoid disk I/O's while looking up the container location.

property.name: ozone.scm.dead.node.interval
property.description: The interval between heartbeats before a node is tagged as dead.

property.name: ozone.scm.handler.count.key
property.description:
The number of RPC handler threads for each SCM service endpoint.
The default is appropriate for small clusters (tens of nodes).
Set a value that is appropriate for the cluster size. Generally, HDFS recommends RPC handler count is set to 20 * log2(Cluster Size) with an upper limit of 200. However, SCM will not have the same amount of traffic as Namenode, so a value much smaller than that will work well too.

property.name: hdds.heartbeat.interval
property.description: The heartbeat interval from a data node to SCM. Yes, it is not three but 30, since most data nodes will heart beating via Ratis heartbeats. If a client is not able to talk to a data node, it will notify OM/SCM eventually. So a 30 second HB seems to work. This assumes that replication strategy used is Ratis if not, this value should be set to something smaller like 3 seconds. ozone.scm.pipeline.close.timeout should also be adjusted accordingly, if the default value for this config is not used.

property.name: ozone.scm.heartbeat.log.warn.interval.count
property.description: Defines how frequently we will log the missing of a heartbeat to SCM. For example in the default case, we will write a warning message for each ten consecutive heartbeats that we miss to SCM. This helps in reducing clutter in a data node log, but trade off is that logs will have less of this statement.

property.name: ozone.scm.heartbeat.rpc-timeout
property.description: Timeout value for the RPC from Datanode to SCM.

property.name: ozone.scm.heartbeat.thread.interval
property.description:
When a heartbeat from the data node arrives on SCM, It is queued for processing with the time stamp of when the heartbeat arrived. There is a heartbeat processing thread inside SCM that runs at a specified interval. This value controls how frequently this thread is run.
There are some assumptions build into SCM such as this value should allow the heartbeat processing thread to run at least three times more frequently than heartbeats and at least five times more than stale node detection time. If you specify a wrong value, SCM will gracefully refuse to run. For more info look at the node manager tests in SCM.
In short, you don't need to change this.

property.name: ozone.scm.http-address
property.description:
The address and the base port where the SCM web ui will listen on.
If the port is 0 then the server will start on a free port.

property.name: ozone.scm.http-bind-host
property.description: The actual address the SCM web server will bind to. If this optional address is set, it overrides only the hostname portion of ozone.scm.http-address.

property.name: ozone.scm.http.enabled
property.description: Property to enable or disable SCM web ui.

property.name: ozone.scm.https-address
property.description:
The address and the base port where the SCM web UI will listen on using HTTPS.
If the port is 0 then the server will start on a free port.

property.name: ozone.scm.https-bind-host
property.description: The actual address the SCM web server will bind to using HTTPS. If this optional address is set, it overrides only the hostname portion of ozone.scm.http-address.

property.name: ozone.scm.names
property.description: The value of this property is a set of DNS | DNS:PORT | IP Address | IP:PORT. Written as a comma separated string. e.g. scm1, scm2:8020, 7.7.7.7:7777. This property allows datanodes to discover where SCM is, so that datanodes can send heartbeat to SCM.

property.name: ozone.scm.stale.node.interval
property.description: The interval for stale node flagging. Please see ozone.scm.heartbeat.thread.interval before changing this value.

property.name: ozone.trace.enabled
property.description: Setting this flag to true dumps the HTTP request/ response in the logs. Very useful when debugging REST protocol.

property.name: scm.container.client.idle.threshold
property.description: In the standalone pipelines, the SCM clients use netty to communicate with the container. It also uses connection pooling to reduce client side overheads. This allows a connection to stay idle for a while before the connection is closed.

property.name: scm.container.client.max.size
property.description: Controls the maximum number of connections that we cached via clientconnection pooling. If the number of connection exceed this count then the oldest idle connection is evicted.

property.name: scm.container.client.max.outstanding.requests
property.description: Controls the maximum number of outstanding async requests that can be handled by the Standalone as well as Ratis client.

property.name: ozone.scm.container.creation.lease.timeout
property.description: Container creation timeout in milliseconds to be used by SCM. When BEGIN_CREATE event happens the container is moved from ALLOCATED to CREATING state, SCM will now wait for the configured amount of time to get COMPLETE_CREATE event if it doesn't receive it will move the container to DELETING.

property.name: ozone.key.preallocation.max.blocks
property.description: While allocating blocks from OM, this configuration limits the maximum number of blocks being allocated. This configuration ensures that the allocated block response do not exceed rpc payload limit. If client needs more space for the write, separate block allocation requests will be made.

property.name: ozone.client.list.cache
property.description: Configuration property to configure the cache size of client list calls.

property.name: ozone.replication
property.description: Default replication value. The actual number of replications can be specified when writing the key. The default is used if replication is not specified. Supported values: 1 and 3.

property.name: ozone.replication.type
property.description: Default replication type to be used while writing key into ozone. The value can be specified when writing the key, default is used when nothing is specified. Supported values: RATIS, STAND_ALONE and CHAINED.

property.name: hdds.container.close.threshold
property.description: This determines the threshold to be used for closing a container. When the container used percentage reaches this threshold, the container will be closed. Value should be a positive, non-zero percentage in float notation (X.Yf), with 1.0f meaning 100%.

property.name: ozone.rest.client.http.connection.max
property.description: This defines the overall connection limit for the connection pool used in RestClient.

property.name: ozone.rest.client.http.connection.per-route.max
property.description: This defines the connection limit per one HTTP route/host. Total max connection is limited by ozone.rest.client.http.connection.max property.

property.name: ozone.open.key.cleanup.service.interval.seconds
property.description: A background job periodically checks open key entries and delete the expired ones. This entry controls the interval of this cleanup check.

property.name: ozone.open.key.expire.threshold
property.description: Controls how long an open key operation is considered active. Specifically, if a key has been open longer than the value of this config entry, that open key is considered as expired (e.g. due to client crash). Default to 24 hours.

property.name: hdds.rest.rest-csrf.enabled
property.description: If true, then enables Object Store REST server protection against cross-site request forgery (CSRF).

property.name: hdds.rest.http-address
property.description: The http address of Object Store REST server inside the datanode.

property.name: hdds.rest.netty.high.watermark
property.description: High watermark configuration to Netty for Object Store REST server.

property.name: hdds.rest.netty.low.watermark
property.description: Low watermark configuration to Netty for Object Store REST server.

property.name: hdds.datanode.plugins
property.description: Comma-separated list of HDDS datanode plug-ins to be activated when HDDS service starts as part of datanode.

property.name: hdds.datanode.storage.utilization.warning.threshold
property.description: If a datanode overall storage utilization exceeds more than this value, a warning will be logged while processing the nodeReport in SCM.

property.name: hdds.datanode.storage.utilization.critical.threshold
property.description: If a datanode overall storage utilization exceeds more than this value, the datanode will be marked out of space.

property.name: hdds.command.status.report.interval
property.description: Time interval of the datanode to send status of commands executed since last report. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: ozone.scm.pipeline.destroy.timeout
property.description: Once a pipeline is closed, SCM should wait for the above configured time before destroying a pipeline.

property.name: ozone.scm.pipeline.creation.interval
property.description: SCM schedules a fixed interval job using the configured interval to create pipelines.

property.name: hdds.scm.safemode.threshold.pct
property.description: % of containers which should have at least one reported replica before SCM comes out of safe mode.

property.name: hdds.scm.wait.time.after.safemode.exit
property.description: After exiting safemode, wait for configured interval of time to start replication monitor and cleanup activities of unhealthy pipelines.

property.name: hdds.scm.safemode.enabled
property.description: Boolean value to enable or disable SCM safe mode.

property.name: hdds.scm.safemode.min.datanode
property.description: Minimum DataNodes which should be registered to get SCM out of safe mode.

property.name: hdds.scm.safemode.pipeline-availability.check
property.description: Boolean value to enable pipeline availability check during SCM safe mode.

property.name: hdds.scm.safemode.healthy.pipelie.pct
property.description: Percentage of healthy pipelines, where all 3 datanodes are reported in the pipeline.

property.name: hdds.scm.safemode.atleast.one.node.reported.pipeline.pct
property.description: Percentage of pipelines, where at least one datanode is reported in the pipeline.

property.name: hdds.containerscrub.enabled
property.description: Boolean value to enable data and metadata scrubbing in the containers running on each datanode.

property.name: hdds.container.action.max.limit

property.name: hdds.pipeline.action.max.limit

property.name: hdds.scm.watcher.timeout
property.description: Timeout for the watchers of the HDDS SCM CommandWatchers. After this duration the Copy/Delete container commands will be sent again to the datanode unless the datanode confirms the completion.

property.name: hdds.db.profile
property.description: This property allows user to pick a configuration that tunes the RocksDB settings for the hardware it is running on. Right now, we have SSD and DISK as profile options.

property.name: hdds.datanode.replication.work.dir
property.description: Temporary which is used during the container replication betweeen datanodes. Should have enough space to store multiple container (in compressed format), but doesn't require fast io access such as SSD.

property.name: hdds.lock.max.concurrency
property.description: Locks in HDDS/Ozone uses object pool to maintain active locks in the system, this property defines the max limit for the locks that will be maintained in the pool.

property.name: ozone.s3g.authentication.kerberos.principal
property.description: The server principal used by Ozone S3Gateway server. This is typically set to HTTP/_HOST@REALM.TLD The SPNEGO server principal begins with the prefix HTTP/ by convention.

property.name: ozone.s3g.domain.name
property.description: List of Ozone S3Gateway domain names. If multiple domain names to be provided, they should be a "," seperated. This parameter is only required when virtual host style pattern is followed.

property.description: The address and the base port where the Ozone S3Gateway Server will listen on.

property.name: ozone.s3g.http-bind-host
property.description: The actual address the HTTP server will bind to. If this optional address is set, it overrides only the hostname portion of ozone.s3g.http-address. This is useful for making the Ozone S3Gateway HTTP server listen on all interfaces by setting it to 0.0.0.0.

property.name: ozone.s3g.http.enabled

property.name: ozone.s3g.keytab.file

property.name: ozone.om.save.metrics.interval

property.name: ozone.security.enabled

property.name: ozone.client.checksum.type

property.name: ozone.client.bytes.per.checksum
property.description: Checksum will be computed for every bytes per checksum number of bytes and stored sequentially. The minimum value for this config is 256KB.

property.name: ozone.client.verify.checksum
property.description: Ozone client to verify checksum of the checksum blocksize data.

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.port
property.description: The port number of the OzoneManager's Ratis server.

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.rpc.type
property.description: Ratis supports different kinds of transports like netty, GRPC, Hadoop RPC etc. This picks one of those for this cluster.

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.storage.dir
property.description: This directory is used for storing OM's Ratis metadata like logs. If this is not set then default metadata dirs is used. A warning will be logged if this not set. Ideally, this should be mapped to a fast disk like an SSD.

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.segment.size
property.description: The size of the raft segment used by Apache Ratis on OM. (16 KB by default)

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.segment.preallocated.size
property.description: The size of the buffer which is preallocated for raft segment used by Apache Ratis on OM.(16 KB by default)

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.log.appender.queue.num-elements
property.description: Number of operation pending with Raft's Log Worker.

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.log.appender.queue.byte-limit
property.description: Byte limit for Raft's Log Worker queue.

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.snapshot.auto.trigger.threshold

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.server.retry.cache.timeout

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.minimum.timeout

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.client.request.timeout.duration

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.client.request.retry.interval

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.server.failure.timeout.duration

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.server.role.check.interval
property.description: The interval between OM leader performing a role check on its ratis server. Ratis server informs OM if it loses the leader role. The scheduled check is an secondary check to ensure that the leader role is updated periodically .

property.name: ozone.client.retry.max.attempts
property.description: Max retry attempts for Ozone RpcClient talking to OzoneManagers.

property.name: ozone.client.failover.max.attempts
property.description: Expert only. The number of client failover attempts that should be made before the failover is considered failed.

property.name: ozone.client.failover.sleep.base.millis
property.description: Expert only. The time to wait, in milliseconds, between failover attempts increases exponentially as a function of the number of attempts made so far, with a random factor of +/- 50%. This option specifies the base value used in the failover calculation. The first failover will retry immediately. The 2nd failover attempt will delay at least ozone.client.failover.sleep.base.millis milliseconds. And so on.

property.name: ozone.client.failover.sleep.max.millis
property.description: Expert only. The time to wait, in milliseconds, between failover attempts increases exponentially as a function of the number of attempts made so far, with a random factor of +/- 50%. This option specifies the maximum value to wait between failovers. Specifically, the time between two failover attempts will not exceed +/- 50% of ozone.client.failover.sleep.max.millis milliseconds.

The address and the base port where the Recon web UI will listen on.

property.name: ozone.recon.container.db.cache.size.mb
property.description:
The size of Recon DB cache in MB that used for caching files. This value is set to an abnormally low value in the default configuration. That is to make unit testing easy. Generally, this value should be set to something like 16GB or more, if you intend to use Recon at scale.
A large value for this key allows a proportionally larger amount of Recon container DB to be cached in memory. This makes Recon Container-Key operations faster.
